drupalNodeEvent.title: Jokebooks and Humour Publications in Late-Ming China

field_speakers.processed: Dr Elizabeth Smithrosser (International Institute for Asian Studies, Leiden)

field_description.processed: From the mid-1500s onwards, Ming China saw a boom in printing and publishing which generated an explosion of fresh intellectual currents, increased the accessibility of all kinds of information and fundamentally altered peopleâ€™s relationship with knowledge and the written word. This talk will place the spotlight on the little-studied corpus of jokebooks and humour publications that rose up amid this flurry of activity.
